DUREcFykfC5LhQ0hzPJlbw.text: Right location, wrong taste buds.  We found this place as we were strolling down Rose St.  on Friday evening.  While we knew there are better Indian restaurants on other parts of town, we thought we'd give it a try especially because there were tables available (I wonder...).  We ordered the ordinary dishes: chicken tikka, veg pakora, mix tandoori, chicken tikka masala and goolab jamun.  Now... I'd have given a 3-star rating if these ordinary dishes tasted ordinary.  Unfortunately, only the goolab jamun and the veg pakora tasted ordinary.  We asked the mix tandoori to be spicy and they came out almost bland.  It came (unexpectedly) with a dipping sauce, but the sauce made it worse as it tasted like a marinara sauce bought from Tesco.  We asked for a spicier sauce, but apparently adding chili to the sauce made it taste like... pasta sauce with chili.  The tikka masala wasn't as bland as the tandoori, but it just tasted like they forgot one or two spices.  One thing for sure... there are many better options for curry in Edinburgh.

T3Z5EJd8iljGNK52AYlJAQ.text: This restaurant is introduced at tour information map. Generally, such kind of restaurant is not good. But such principal is not applied to this restaurant. We ordered several food including 6 curries. Surprisingly, none of those curries did not disappoint me. Quality of food is good.

d4wIfe9yZBV66F60bdjJaQ.text: I was looking for Indian in Edinburgh, a little later than most people's dinner time. Coming across Tippoo Sahib (or Tipu's Indian Lounge, as it says on their business card), there was still plenty of customers, and the staff found me a table quickly.  The food was tasty, and not massively sized (and so I was actually able to eat it all). The service was quite fast, the waiters friendly and willing to guide me to what kind of dish I felt like.  If I was a local, I'd probably make semi-regular visits. Definitely gets the thumbs up.

8GzRhyLmjlDVHFqTQu2KLw.text: Well this restaurant saved our Christmas hunger becasue it was the only restaurant open on Christmas Day in Central Edinburgh. We have been roaming in North/South Bridge area, Dundas Street, Rose Street, part of Cowgate, part of the Royal Mile = everything was closed and deserted !!! (I thought it was the end of the world!)  When we found this Indian restaurant at about 5pm, we first ordered a coffee and deserts. For this I would give 2or3 points because they were so sweet as if eating a lump of sugar (and mostly based on icecream), though of course they were very good. The deserts were just under a fiver and found them expensive. I am used to pay 3Pounds.   Optionless, we dined here at about 7:30pm too. We had a good service and the waiters were okay, though it's a bit True, they come with several suggestions to order this and that, though I think it was a good suggestion to order their 'bread' as you can use it to enjoy the sauce instead otherwise leaving it on the plate. We ordered a starter (mixed kebabs) and main course and the food was tasty and at the right proportions.  A small negative was the sparkling water - we wanted a big bottle and the waiter told us it comes in glasses as the sparkling water comes from a machine (a machine?)  Well, I assume they fill the glasses from a bottle so as you pay more. The glasses were pretty small and the drinks a bit expensive. They merit a 3 points in general, but giving 4 because they saved our Christmas Day.   IF you happen to be a tourist in Christmas, make sure you go to Tesco on the 24th to buy food!  (even the hotel restaurant was closed!)

oQXAeajKsr1JnsnUcTwbLA.text: Very very rude. I don't like to give negative review, but here it is.  We came here around 7.45 and quite hungry. Ours was large group of 9 people, mix of kids adults and seniors. And with mix food preference - vegetarian, non - vegetarians and veg with no onion garlic.  The server didn't want to answer and was irritated with our questions.  When we asked to let us sit together, he got more irritated but gave us sitting together.  I would have preferred if he could have been honest and  said politely can't serve with these choices. He DID NOT HAVE TO BE RUDE. Period.  I should have seen previous reviews. This is a Racist place. Indians or dark skin people, PLEASE stay away. This is kind of sad and hilarious that Indian people treating like this.  In end my niece cried, and they asked us to leave. When I said I'm disappointed and your previous reviews says you are racist. To that their reply was Indians are cheap and they want to share food to save money so that's why Indians wrote bad reviews.  I'm like if they pay money in full who are you to tell them not to share but whatever.

fZ3P0AjqqmmPwldRrgK65A.text: Absolute case of reverse racism!!!! As a frequent global traveler, while I love global cuisine, I always look forward to a palate reset every once in a while. And therefore, when we saw this Indian restaurant open right across the street my eyes lit up!  The food by itself was average. But the service was absolutely pathetic. For some reason the waiter, despite knowing we were from India, insisted on speaking to us in broken English. Which is fine! Never had a problem with that. But for some reason , he assumed that if we are from India, we must be cheap!!! It was late in the evening and between the 3 of us, we didn't want to over order. And so I asked him a simple question- what are the quantities like, and how many dishes should we be ordering? His prejudice forced him to assume I was trying to save money! And so he responded promptly without giving it any thought- You will have to order 3 separate dishes!!!! Well, we did and though the roti/ naans were huge, the quantity of the other dishes perhaps did warrant us ordering 3 dishes, but his overall attitude while serving us was shameful.  It is sad when people of your own country look down upon you purely owing to their own insecurities and prejudices. My advise to these guys is- wake up and smell the roses! Your country has progressed a lot since you left your homes and came here to make a living. And be proud of who you are, and where you come from! By disrespecting your own country men, you are disgracing your own country!  Sad and extremely disturbing.   My sincere advise- avoid this place. They don't deserve your business.

fLyvyG0S6Jgc7e9t4OAdwg.text: Went for dinner there with my 2 teens.  The manager offered to give us the menu at 39 for 3 which we gladly accepted.  As it was my kids first time eating indian food, we also asked that they did not make it too spicy.  The food did not have any flavor and was spicy, so we did not eat too much of it. When came the bill, we were all shocked as it was over 70 for the three of us, granted we ordered 4 small bottles of spring water.  I complained to the manager and he got pissed off and started being very rude.   Not sure how they could advertised as one of the best indian restaurant in Edinburgh.  I have had much better indian food in France and in the US. Everything there was such a disappointment, from the food to the service!   Spend your money somewhere else.  Not worth it! :(

vg-OxgTmoX_C-3zQV5itEg.text: Absolutely disgusting service. They look at Indians as cheap people, me and wife were treated very badly, walked out of the restaurant without having food. No respect to customers. PATHETIC!! PATHETIC! Avoid this place.

zEFcirLIs8_luK-03HoMVA.text: We came to this restuarant and showed a coupon to the manager that said 10% off. He said every person has to order one entree, starters don't count and kids meals don't count. The coupon which is in every flyer of city maps didn't say it. Anyways, we ordered food, Lambs Chops and Rogan Josh. Both  were very light on spices and salt. Tomatoes used seemed like canned tomatoes, didn't feel they cook to justify the cost they ask. In short, not Indian food, maybe Scottish Indian food. Suggestion: stay away.

OSIsjosbV1x0S0hlpRctoA.text: DISGUSTING PLACE. The waiter was absolutely rude and when my husband was asking him about portions his reply was if that's expensive try different place. We both just got up and came out and when complained to the manager/owner he says we have mentioned the portion in the menu and started to support the waiter . I didn't get a single apology from any of them. There customer service is ridiculous. Very RUDE. Indians being racist to Indians is something I have never seen but here.  Our evening was completely spoiled thanks to this bullshit place.

ysNjByyP428tK7OCCqJ5KA.text: Very poor customer service. Had to ask for the water. Ordered still bottled water and wife had to pour by herself. Waiter/ busboy just stood around.  No names on shirt, can't identify.

GtNcpVXva_Ag-kTXADnGUQ.text: Worst Indian food I've had. Prawns are flavorless, Rogan Josh and Masala are essentially tasteless.  The place has a bait and switch 2 for 1 deal outside. Don't trust it. It's actually a terrible deal that requires you to buy about 50 more.  Another swindle, they told us the papadum was complimentary and charged us around 11.  Don't waste your time, money, or sanity here. Go to the black cat across the street or the pizza place down rose st. Literally anything else.  We should have checked Yelp before going. Damn.

aaRNeNzt-oUewiI7hhX3YA.text: Well first, apropos the other reviews, I come to an Indian restaurant expecting Indian food   This was good. Service was typical Scottish that we have come to expect. UK just doesn't have the same customer service as Canada but if you accept this then you realize it is just the norm. Food- naan was tasty but my partner said a bit thinner than he likes. I thought it was great. I had butter chicken and it, was sweeter than we normally get. It wasn't bad by any means and we finished to the last drop. Partner had Lamb Balti. This was amazing. I'm not sure that anyone could say it was tasteless so maybe if you want bursting in your mouth, capturing your tastebuds and wrestling them to the ground, consider ordering this. Mango Lassi was standard, No surprises.  The sneak treat was the haggis pakora. As we have never seen that at home we ordered it and both enjoyed it greatly. Whatever you may think of haggis, this one is a good one to try: two crab cake size pieces that were quite tasty and good for sharing. All in all I would come back again.

rxtezwqqJjRQn7rWs3wTPQ.text: Their lunch special was a steal! Great spicy tikka Marsala and bhuna was just about good amount for us. No meal can come this good for three course meal for 6.95. Appetizers were delicious along with those main dishes. Highly recommended to check out!

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Lounge Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom
Photo of Indian Lounge Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Interior design
Photo of Indian Lounge Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

OlWAh1t68dOD2yvx7_SSUA.text: One of the most terrible restaurants ever! For the record, I know a thing or two about Indian food and this was by far one of the worst. We're vegetarians. We tried the daal, mixed veggie curry, malai sabji, naan, raita, veggie pakoras,bhajji, sliced mushrooms. They all tasted the same and greasy. The malai kofta had no kofta. Just potatoes. The service was poor with the person just being crummy to us. My child was eating lunch and he was banging on the table with a kiddie spoon that I had brought with me. While I was trying to stop him, another waiter comes running to declare that we shouldn't damage his tables. Just grumpy and mean. The portions were ok for us. We ordered 5 dishes for 4 adults and a toddler.  But can't imagine this would be enough for folks with bigger portions than us. Definitely won't recommend or won't go back there again.

9HhCaiWWosgM3PPUo0wCvQ.text: Great food, reasonably priced, took advantage of the 2x1 promotion- good deal (available 5-7pm) service and ambiance could be improved.

Egn3wpQb4mMNvn8bXMVoIA.text: Found this place because of an ad in a free tourist magazine and was pleasantly surprised. Yes, the staff are a bit pushy, but I have found that just to be part of the Indian culture. I got soup and a curry while my friend got fried vegetables and lamb and we ate everything. The garlic naan was green though...not sure why....and a bit burnt.  The set up was really nice--paintings on the walls of events that happened, decorations around the doors--although it was a bit cramped.  If you go before 7 (?) one of the entrees is free when you get 2 appetizers as well!

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Lounge Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

4r2qSGZPVUPvvQGZL_LFNw.text: Great, authentic Punjabi cuisine. They have a delicious sag paneer that's not on the menu, if anyone's a paneer fan. Their tandoori chicken is incredibly juicy. Overall it was a great experience at a reasonable price.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Lounge Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom. Sag paneer, lamb tikka masala, tandoori chicken, garlic rice, and fresh nan. Delicious.

DrbhBVswpV7ppt_441s4FQ.text: The food is tasty, the attitude and customer service leave a really bad taste.  I'm visiting Edinburgh on a long holiday.  I wanted to do delivery or takeaway Indian and - having eaten here before - thought they'd be a good option.  They CLEARLY advertise the ability to place an order through Deliveroo or do takeaway.  Well, that's False advertising.  They rejected both my attempts at delivery.  And, then refused to let me place a takeaway order.  Even after I shared with them that I was a repeat customer.  They were incredibly rude about it.  So much for trying to be a repeat customer or show a local business some loyalty while on holiday.  I've just ordered from a much nicer Indian restaurant who gladly accepted my business and my preference on delivery.  Indian Lounge....NEVER EVER AGAIN.  I hope this review helps visitors to this city make a choice other than you.

cfl22IEIvXCYScNzgUifSQ.text: Decent curry. Not the best I have had but OK. The chicken korma was a little lacking on flavor. The tandoori chicken however was great. I'd go again if I had the chance.

photos.caption: Photo of Indian Lounge Restaurant - Edinburgh, United Kingdom

afp062Jjx5JkgGglwQNlow.text: The food here was delicious! It was some of the best Indian food I've ever had. We were very happy with all the items we ordered and the recommendations the server made. The only odd thing was that the server said we could not just have tap water for our first drink, so we ordered a beer.

QHf8KRcR85OT-MxVnewXMw.text: I'd give this a significantly lower score than 1 if possible! The restaurant looked interesting and the menu ok, but the food was of particularly poor quality, the portion sizes small, the staff pushy and rude, and the interior very shabby.  Whoever was decorating the place also deemed it appropriate to cover the walls with a huge mural of the British invasion of India - interesting choice!  Maybe it's supposed to contrast with staff - "Hey, at least we're not as bad as those guys!" We were very let down by just about every aspect of the experience.  Overall, one of the worst restaurants I've ever been to.  The place is in a basement already; I reckon we ought to fill in the stairwell and bury it altogether in order to save any other misguided folk from a surely ruined evening.

UtWNxnfWzCRmnCBMe4bfLA.text: I am from India and I grew up eating Indian food..I have tried Indian food all over the world but this place is the worst!i am on a vacation here in Edinburgh and this was the closest place to where I live.so,I just wanted to try it.if you guys are looking for an authentic Indian food with great service,this is not the right place.my dinner was served after an hr of waiting.i had to ask the waiter if he had forgotten my order!worst experience ever!food was served cold..won't recommend this place to anyone!i would give this place a zero star if I had an option!
